sessions.title: Opening Session (This session is open to the public Signing Up required)
sessions.details:
Welcoming words + Roc Parés i Burguès Performance + Scene Report Microtalks. 09:00 – Accreditations
09:30 – Opening session
10:00 – Keynote lecture In becoming: Art practice as research, by Roc Parés i Burguès, professor at the Department of Communication, UPF.
10:45 – Roundtable The scene report
Moderator: Luján Oulton
Participants: Cindy Poremba (Canada), Pablo Quarta (Argentina), Marie Janin (Netherlands).

sessions.title: Fun session!
sessions.details: Lunch, followed by playful introductions at the Pompeu. Exploring the translations of play, fun, and games in different cultures.

sessions.title: Scene Report
sessions.details: GAIA participants share a snapshot update on their current projects.

sessions.title: Coffee Break
sessions.details: BREAK

sessions.title: Public Sector Hustle
sessions.details: Making it work! How we hustle, from public sector organizations, NGOs, and foundations.

sessions.title: Gamelab showcase + cocktail (this session is open to the public)
sessions.details: Demo and social

sessions.title: Non-interactive Exhibits
sessions.details: Exploring exhibition strategies for displaying videogames in art contexts, the place of spectatorship, and making invisible game content visible to audiences.

sessions.title: Coffee Break
sessions.details: BREAK

sessions.title: Browser Museums
sessions.details: Building new online platforms for curating and accessing games, including 3D multi-user browser exhibitions and alternatives to algorithmic recommendations.

sessions.title: Lunch break
sessions.details: Lunch break

sessions.title: GACK2
sessions.details: Collective workshop on the Game Arts Curatorial Kit volume 2, focusing on case studies of game events, festivals, and exhibitions worldwide.

sessions.title: Coffee Break
sessions.details: BREAK

sessions.title: Sustainability Roundtable
sessions.details: Discussion on running long-term initiatives, maintaining motivation, avoiding burnout, and keeping communities fresh and exciting over 5+ years.

sessions.title: Playformance!
sessions.details: Open to public

sessions.title: Global South Curators
sessions.details: Two perspectives on game development advocacy: self-producing game jams in the Philippines and 11 years of supporting the African game development ecosystem.

sessions.title: Coffee Break
sessions.details: BREAK

sessions.title: Fighting back
sessions.details: Videogame co-ops, collective organizations, and game arts initiatives as alternatives.

sessions.title: Lunch break

sessions.title: Unconference
sessions.details: Open session led by all participants to discuss emerging topics and collaborative ideas.

sessions.details: We travel together!
